sentences.en: At 17 she found her true vocation as a writer.
sentences.cn: 17岁时她找到了自己真正的使命——当一名作家。

sentences.en: He found his vocation in ornithology.
sentences.cn: 他发现自己适于专攻鸟类学.

sentences.en: He is desperate to pursue his vocation as an artist.
sentences.cn: 他不顾一切地从事艺术的职业.

sentences.en: He saw his vocation as one of prayer and apostolic work.
sentences.cn: 他认为从事祷告和门徒的工作是他的使命。

sentences.en: Her vocation is her work as an actress.
His deformity totally disabled him from following his vocation.
sentences.cn: 他的残疾使他完全失去了从事他的职业的能力.

sentences.en: It became urgent that I should have a vocation of some kind.
sentences.cn: 我要找个什么职业,这已经是迫不急待的事了.

sentences.en: It could well be that he has a real vocation.
sentences.cn: 很可能他是找到了自己真正的使命。

sentences.en: Make authorship your avocation, not your vocation.
sentences.cn: 把写作当作你的副业, 不要把它当作正业.

sentences.en: Nursing is not just a job—it's a vocation.
sentences.cn: 护理不仅仅是一项工作，而且还是一种职业。

sentences.en: She felt it was her vocation to minister to the sick.
sentences.cn: 她觉得照料病人是她的天职.

sentences.en: She has no vocation for teaching.
She seems to have a vocation for healing.
sentences.cn: 看来她具备治病救人的才能.

sentences.en: She struggled for years to find her true vocation.
sentences.cn: 她多年来苦苦寻找真正适合自己的职业.

sentences.en: The vocation advocate found the word "vocal" and "reciprocal" not in the vocabulary.
sentences.cn: 职业倡导者发现“嗓音的”和“交互的”两词不在词汇表中。

sentences.en: Trades union leadership in those days was less a career than a vocation.
sentences.cn: 那时候的工会领导与其说是一份职业，倒不如说是一种使命。

trans.tran_en: a strong belief that you have been chosen by God to be a priest or a nun
